Array

Create an Array

The JavaScript Array object is a global object that is used to construct arrays; which are high-level, list-like objects. Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable.

An array can hold many values under a single name that can be accessed using an index number.

The typeof operator in JavaScript returns 'object' for arrays. Arrays use numbers (indexes) to access elements. Objects use names (key/value pairs) to access it's 'members'. In JavaScript, it is best to describe arrays as arrays and not objects.

An example to create an empty array:

                        

var array = [ ];

Assign values

Once an array has been created, values (elements) can be assigned. The following example creates an array to list a number of fruits.

                        

var fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

Length property

The length property returns the number of elements within the array. This is the length of the array.

                        

var fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

fruits.length;    // 3

Accessing Array elements

Each element in an array has an index number. [0] is the first element in an array, [1] is the second, and so on. The first element in an array always starts at 0.

                        

var fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

fruits[0];    // Apple
fruits[1];    // Banana
fruits[2];    // Orange

// Return the last element in the array
fruits[fruits.length - 1];

Adding elements

New elements can be added to the end of an array using the push() method or length property. Here we are using both examples to add 'Lemon' or 'Pear' as a new element into our Array.

                        

var fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

// Returns: ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange', 'Lemon']
fruits.push( 'Lemon' );

// Returns: ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange', 'Pear']
fruits[fruits.length] = 'Pear';

Removing elements

To remove the last element from an array, the pop() method can be used.

                        

var fruits = ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange'];

fruits.pop();    // Remove the last element, returns 'Orange'

Sorting the Array

To alphabetically sort an array, the sort() method can be used.

                        

var fruits = ['Banana', 'Apple', 'Orange'];

// Returns: ['Apple', 'Banana', 'Orange']
fruits.sort();
